intro: Symplocos monticola, commonly known as the mountain symplocos, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the Himalayas and is typically found in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small, berry-like drupes that mature to a dark red color. Symplocos monticola plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various wildlife species.
